intro: Mastigion fascinator, commonly known as the crown of thorns, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its spiny, woody stems and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant produces berries that are toxic to humans and animals, containing cardiac glycosides. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, with a rough texture. Mastigion fascinator is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience in arid conditions.
